content.description: Stand start on a flat block and the right side of the long horizontal rail. Head up and right on side pulls to crimps at the top, mantel!
content.location:
Head left at the split in the trail before the dried up pond, follow this trail for a bit. The trail will split again and go left. You'll see this boulder on the right.

(33.006709, -116.962955)

content.description: Hard first move leads to a very cool combo sloper and pinch feature.
content.location:
On the south side of the Sherwood Forest directly behind the Terror Eyes / Mind on Fire boulder. From Terror Eyes walk counter-clockwise around the boulder hopefully not through any poison oak.

Squat start with left hand of a very left facing side pull and right hand on a bad sloper/edge thing. Pull over the obvious foot and make one hard slap up.

Coords: (33.006717, -116.963070)

content.description: Stand start on match-able flat edge with a knob on it, climb through the middle crux to better holds as you get higher then at the top throw your legs around to the other side and saddle up! to mantle.
content.location:
From the pond trail to the 'T' at the dirt road go left, at the first u-turn look straight up the hill and slightly right to see the top of the boulder.

Coordinates: (33.0075962, -116.9637141)

content.description:
Fun traversing face climb!

Low start down and right on a mini jug, traverse up and left using jugs, under cling, edges, rail and side pulls to the lip.
content.location:
From asphalt road by the yellow house, take the dirt trail that goes right. When at the first 'T' in the trailhead left, eventually you'll walk by a dried up pond and not long after that the trail will come to another 'T' with a large dirt road, at this point go right, not to far down the dirt road on the left side will be the boulder.

Coordinates: (33.0090880, -116.9612656)

content.description:
Sit start low on sloping shelf , right foot up pressed against left facing triangle towards the far right side of shelf. Powerful move leads to a jug then pop for the top where a small crimp is used to work the bulge.

Stand start at jug goes at V1 or so....
content.location:
The trail splits soon before getting to the dried up pond, go left at the split. This boulder will be seen on the right side of the trail.

Coords: (33.007065, -116.961780)

content.description: Start low, follow the side-pull features then straight up to a jug. Crux is not breaking the foothold you use to start. Kinda chossy but it’s a nice little warm up,
content.location:
On the same Boulder as “In The Shadows”, next to Terror Eyes/Mind On Fire boulder.

Coordinates: (33.006798, -116.962924)

content.description: Same start as Terror Eyes, travers left and head up for a right facing side pull. Match, bump off a triangle hold to go for a small quarter pad crimp with the left hand. Then work for the finish!
content.location:
Left of Terror Eyes

Coords: (33.006709, -116.962955)

content.description: The obvious left leaning crack on the South face.  Originally done solo before the bolt was added to the top.
content.location:
Little John boulder

Coords: (33.007145, -116.963010)

content.description: The arete left of Little John's crack.
content.location:
Little John boulder

Coords: (33.007145, -116.963010)

content.description: Rounded arete, definatley harder than the left arete.  Seemed similar in dificulty to the center face.
content.location:
The right arete of Little John Face starting on the left side of the arête. Thin edges to the bald arête.

Coords: (33.007145, -116.963010)

content.description: Rounded arete to slightly balancy move near the top
content.location:
Left Arete of Little John face

Coords: (33.007145, -116.963010)

content.description: Up the center of the East face.
content.protection: TR bolt on top; easy to set up from the backside.
content.location:
Triangle boulder

Coords: (33.007145, -116.963010)

content.description: Rough crack, mostly fingers, sometimes a spider or two
content.protection: You can climb the tree and set a TR with some cams, if you're lite.
content.location: Sherwood Forest near the little john broulder

content.description: Arete to the left of I Shot the Sheriff.  Start on wide opposing  sidepulls on the left side of the arete.  Move up using the arete, sidepull rail, and funky moves.  Really cool line.
content.location: On the same boulder as Lindner Crack and I Shot the Sheriff.  Just below High Expectations.  Downclimb the tree.

content.description: Squat start matched on a slot, set feet up and pop for the sloper. Using diagonal seams to the right compress your way up to a good finish hold.
content.location:
Visible and just below Terror Eyes/Mind On Fire boulder

Coords: (33.006798, -116.962924)

climbs.name: I Shot the Sheriff (aka Take That)

content.description: Right traversing crack
content.location: Boulder just North of the Triangle boulder

content.description:
If your looking for something a little outta the box then check out this climb. A fun and challenging run'n jump!

High Expectations is toward the LEFT side of the wave like boulder (where the large black streak ends) there are no holds on the face just a low horizontal seam near the bottom to jump off.

Have fun!
content.location:
When on the trail passing the dried up pond you'll come to a 'T' with a dirt road, head left on the road up hill. When you get to the first U-turn in the road look directly left and you'll see the top backside of the boulder.

Coordinates: (33.0073242, -116.9631810)

content.description:
Sit start and climb the clean, right-leaning splitter. The rock quality is excellent.

From a standing start it's a tad harder than Jaws, but the sit start bumps up the difficulty and quality a couple notches. The crack is very uniform and packs a punch despite its short stature.

This climb is named in honor of my son, the light of my life. At six years old, he has the perfect size mitts for this problem.
content.location: Midway between the Sherwood Forest and Hard as Nails.

content.description:
Start low on horizontal crack to right of arete. Traverse out left and up. Top out the slab.

Downclimb on the back corner opposite the climb. Be careful
content.location:
Visible from Spike. From the main dirt trail, just past spike on your right, head into the woods and you'll enter a grassy meadow with a large tree over it. You should come across a trail on your right to exit the meadow. Follow this trail. Shortly past a boulder on your right, you will come to another trail on your right. Follow this for a short bit and it will open up to another grassy section with some small boulders in it. There is a trail down to the climb, down hill from the grassy section. Be careful of poison oak.

(33.008989,-116.961896)

content.description: Up the center of this cool looking boulder.  Stay right for full value.  Left variation is much easier.
content.location: Off the fire road past Little John and take the first right fork.
